intro: Humbertacalia leucopappa, commonly known as the white-hued rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters along the stems. Humbertacalia leucopappa is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to flourish in challenging environmental conditions.
